metadata.title: CVE-2019-11325 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Symfony before 4.2.12 and 4.3.x before 4.3.8.The VarExport component incorrectly escapes strings, allowing somespecially crafted ones to escalate to execution of arbitrary PHP code. Thisis related to symfony/var-exporter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-sqs-messenger - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amqp-messenger - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1

criterions.comment: symfony package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
